result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles R. Kuhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning October 1, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Restitution shall be determined within 30 days.  Restitution shall be joint and several with the co-defendant.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to M.M., C.K. and B.P within 30 days of sentencing and shall be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendant, Anthony Marshall.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

to Defendant Re: Payment Plan

2:18 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court, in custody.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Plea of guilty   Count 1 - misd battery - 22CF21 and plea of guilty - 22CF19-  count 1 - burglary party to a crime.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Count 1 - misd battery - 22CF21 and plea of guilty - 22CF19-  count 1 - burglary party to a crime.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Nussberger.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders withheld sentence and placement on probation - 22CF21 - 2 years and 2CF19 - 3 years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; restitution to be determined within 30 days of sentencing and joint and several with Anthony Marshall; letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation - 22CF19 no contact with Anthony Marshall.  11 days of sentence credit on each case.   Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts and 22CM24. Payment plan of $25.00 a month beginning October 1, 2022.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Letter to the Court from Attorney Nussberger

3:38 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn not in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied.  Statement by Attorney Nussberger.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a body only warrant.  Attorney Tlusty has no objection to staying the warrant until 4:30 today.  Court issues body only warrants and stay until 4:30 today.  Clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings and stay until 4:30 today.

1:50 PM Defendant Charles R. Kuhn in court.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger in court for Charles R. Kuhn.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial. - rt
